definition: The resistance or force experienced by an object moving through a medium, typically air, which opposes its motion. This term is commonly used in the context of physics and engineering to describe the resistance encountered by vehicles, projectiles, or other objects as they travel through the air.

examples.german: Der Luftwiderstand beeinflusst die Geschwindigkeit des Autos.
examples.english: Air resistance affects the speed of the car.

examples.german: Ein aerodynamisches Design verringert den Luftwiderstand.
examples.english: An aerodynamic design reduces air resistance.

examples.german: Der Luftwiderstand ist ein wichtiger Faktor bei der Flugzeugkonstruktion.
examples.english: Air resistance is an important factor in aircraft design.

examples.german: Der Luftwiderstand kann den Fall eines Objekts verlangsamen.
examples.english: Air resistance can slow down the fall of an object.

examples.german: Der Luftwiderstand nimmt mit steigender Geschwindigkeit zu.
examples.english: Air resistance increases with higher speed.
